modName: Clanbringer  a Morrowind Artifact for Skyrim
summary: A small weapon add on for Dragonborn DLC to improve upon Thrisk Mead Hall
descriptionHtml:
"when the snow falls and the wind blows, the man dies but the Clan survives"- etched onto the blade


Requirements:
- Skyrim patched to 1.9
- Dragonborn DLC

Recommended:
- Better Shaped Weapons http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39870/? (makes all swords look 100x better)

Version Key:
Version 0.1 - MainFile REQUIRED always
Version 0.2 - Texture improvement for Clanbringer, replace textures from the main file

Backstory:

What I liked about Morrowind was all the random unique items, even on side quests. In BloodMoon, when you completed the Mead Hall Massacre quest you got a room, a weapon and a new book for your trouble at a pretty awesome location, the Thrisk Mead Hall.

Originally this mod was just to add a small "home" to the Thrisk Mead Hall in Dragonborn, without messing up the original layout of the hall and without forcing a player to choose rieklings or Nords.

Anyway to make a long story short (too late), this mod escalated to making a weapon with a custom appearance with backstory while still providing my orginal idea of a "home" at Thrisk Mead Hall.


What you get:
- A "loft" in the Thrisk Mead Hall. Has a bed, a chair and table, and a chest (nonrespawning) for storage. Works regardless of who you chose as masters of Thrisk.

- A weapon that made an appearance in Bloodmoon Morrowind. Backstory provided via a journal.

- A new puzzle. Actually a Riddle but it should be easy to figure out if you think about it for a min. that you have to solve in order to get Clanbringer. (see below)

- Added benefit of returning to Thrisk, instead of a one and done attitude like when you go dungeon diving.

Notes:
- will improve textures and potentially the model in the near future.
- if asked for I may make a different mod that revamps Thrisk Mead Hall similar (without forsaking this design) how it looked in Morrowind.
- the pictures do not do the sword justice...download and have a look.
- for this early release Clanbringer is not enchanted, a latter release will hopefully have a custom enchantment similar to Morrowind's.

Credits:

- Bethesda for Skyrim and Dragonborn and Morrowind and Bloodmoon
- LeanWolf for making BSW (your files were not included...but it makes clanbringer look better)
- Nexus for a wide selection of mods
- GRR Martin for A song of Ice and Fire, the quote that is attached to Clanbringer is a modified quote of his.
- PrivateEye for his work on making mods that bring Morrowind to Skyrim, he inspires me.

Permissions:
-ask, most likely I will say yes.


This is the riddle/puzzle you have to solve if you want to reforge Clanbringer, on the off chance you didn't read the journal provided, found in the Mic menu of said forge. DO NOT SPOIL THE ANSWERS IN THE COMMENT SECTION.

"Brother to iron, sister to copper"
"Valued as gold, yet can't hold its luster"
"Black as night, yet made in a great light"
"Hard as steel, cold as winter"
"Master of forges, Guarded by Lords of the Sky"
